commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Great job and thank you guys so much for today!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Let's toast to that!

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Cheers!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Great job, everyone.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: There sure were a lot of visitors! I guess the big city is just full of people, huh?

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: I wish Uchiura had that many people, too.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I don't think I'd like that too much...

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: *Chuckle* One of the great things about Uchiura is how peaceful and quiet it is, after all.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: You might be right about that!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: But Nijigasaki really does do things on a different scale than us. Their school tour almost became like a little festival itself.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Yes, I could see how much effort was put into the running of it.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Not just the school, but the clubs themselves really went all out.

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: I guess that's what it means to be gifted in academics and everything else in between.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey guys? There's something I wanna tell you all. Shioriko just said we could perform live shows at school festivals.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Wow, the school idol club's finally been recognized! That's so good to hear!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: People really do change when they get to experience school idols for themselves. I'm so happy you guys don't have to worry about your club being abolished anymore.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: I was sort of hoping for something like that to happen when I heard she was joining in on your practice sessions.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I bet Ayumu's live show cast a little spell on her.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I-I doubt that.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Don't be like that! Your performance was outta this world!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Thanks. I'm really glad to hear you say that.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I think your live show really influenced Shioriko as well.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So that's why I've been thinking...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What do you all think about holding the School Idol Festival at Nijigasaki High School?

commands.speaker: Everyone
commands.line: Whaaaaat?!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: At Nijigasaki?!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah. I mean, look back on what the school tour was like today.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We can use the auditorium for live shows, and we could probably set up a few outdoor stages since we've got a spacious courtyard and sports ground.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The home economics room that the life design course uses is also pretty big, so we could use that to prepare food, right?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We've also got the cafeteria, and I'm sure we could handle any traffic rather smoothly since the station is just nearby.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: And! Doesn't holding a School Idol Festival at an actual school just seem like the natural thing to do?!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Ooooh... Now that you mention it, maybe you're right!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: It never even crossed my mind to use the whole school as the venue for the festival, zura.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Well done, little demon. Your sharpened eyes have pinpointed the perfect location!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: We had the answer right under our noses, huh!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: I do think it's an interesting idea...

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Yes, very much so...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What about from the perspectives of our two student council presidents? Is it a bit of a stretch, maybe?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: It's hard for me to say, since my school and Nijigasaki work on completely different scales.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: I would say it would be difficult if I was looking at it from the perspective of my own school.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: But what you're saying makes complete sense. I guess maybe all that's left is to think about how to convince Mifune.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Right...

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I like the sound of it! You have my vote! Let's go in with the mindset to break through any barriers we might come across!

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: *Chuckle* I wanna avoid breaking things down if I can.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Just the idea of holding the festival at our school is gonna create a buzz itself. It's totally gonna rock.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: The School Idol Festival will also be good publicity for our school if it's a success.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Maybe the school would be more receptive if it means they'll have more potential enrollments?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: If that really is the case, then this idea is full of positives.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: It's a win-win!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Maybe this'll make Shioriko happy, too.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: She's practically an honorary member of the club already, so I'm sure she'll be thrilled.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Maybe she will even take to the stage with us if we hold the festival at our school.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I like the sound of that!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Shioko's a great dancer, so I could totally see her being one of my back-up dancers or something.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: She might stand out more than you.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: You're one to talk. I bet you'd be the one outshined by her.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: *Laugh* All right, so are we good to put this suggestion to Shioriko?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: For sure!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I hope this saves us from the trouble of needing to find a venue.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah, I really hope so too. I want to tell all of the school idols from around the country who've contacted us about where the festival venue is as soon as possible.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'll go ahead and talk to her about it tomorrow!
